Description: Wage Garland Wars, rule a vast empire from a floating city, and defend it from the Spanish conquistadors with droves of experienced infantry.
Navigate the winding rivers and dense jungles of Bengal as you build a thriving economy to fuel unstoppable armies of elephants.
Unite the tribes of Northern Africa and set sail for Europe. Can you hold your ground against the scrambled kingdoms of Iberia?
Represented by the Hussite movement and their distinctive military tactics, including the use of gunpowder weapons.
Forge fractured kingdoms into one, defend your island from overseas incursions with disciplined yeomen levies.
Infantry and cavalry civilization representing the First and Second Bulgarian Empires.
Build a kingdom amongst the forests and rivers of Southeast Asia, utilizing battle elephants to dominate their foes.
The Eastern Roman Empire, a continuation of Roman glory in the East.
Represent medieval Scottish, Irish, and Welsh people, known for swift infantry and fast-firing siege.
One of the oldest and most populous civilizations in the world, with a history of powerful dynasties.
A nomadic Turkic people from Central Asia who formed a large confederation.
Seize control of the lucrative Indian Ocean trade routes and utilize advanced metallurgy as you build one of the wealthiest sea empires of medieval Asia.
Relive the glory of the once mighty Aksumite empire and rule over the Red Sea.
Dominating present-day northern France, Belgium, and western Germany, establishing a powerful Christian kingdom.
Carve out a sturdy kingdom in the shadow of the Caucasus Mountains and use the rugged terrain to your advantage as you repulse countless foreign invasions.
A Germanic people who played a major role in the fall of the Western Roman Empire.

Ride swift mounts across the fertile fields and open plains of western India and unleash diverse armies of sturdy warriors upon your enemies. The Gurjara unique units are the Shrivamsha Rider, a speedy cavalry unit that can dodge enemy attacks, and the Chakram Thrower, an infantry unit that unleashes volleys of deadly metal discs.

From the fertile plains of the Ganges to the arid steppes of Central Asia, the vast and diverse armies of Hindustan once dominated the battlefields of the subcontinent. Mount formidable siege weapons and powerful gunpowder units atop mighty war elephants as you expand your domain and construct magnificent monuments to your glory. The Hindustani unique unit is the Ghulam, a sturdy melee cavalry unit that excels at raiding. [https://ageofempires.fandom.com/wiki/Hindustanis]

From the vast, empty plains of Central Asia, the nomadic Huns thundered into Europe and carved out a fearsome empire through ruthless conquest. Unleash hordes of swift horse archers and devastating siege weaponry upon your hapless foes as you leave a trail of destruction across the ravaged landscape. The Hun unique unit is the Tarkhan, a sturdy cavalry unit that can destroy enemy buildings with ease. [https://ageofempires.fandom.com/wiki/Huns]

High in the Andes Mountains, the Incas forged a powerful empire that stretched for thousands of miles along the western coast of South America. Construct mighty stone fortresses in the clouds, amass vast treasures of gold, and field disciplined armies of hardy warriors to defend your mountain strongholds. The Inca unique unit is the Kamayuk, a sturdy spearman that excels at close-quarters combat. [https://ageofempires.fandom.com/wiki/Incas]
Peak Iconic Year: Early 16th century AD (height of the Inca Empire before Spanish conquest)

Description: From the bustling ports of Venice and Genoa to the proud duchies of Milan and Florence, the Italian peninsula was a vibrant center of trade, culture, and innovation during the Middle Ages. Amass wealth through your powerful trade networks, construct magnificent cathedrals and universities, and field versatile armies of skilled mercenaries to dominate the battlefields of Europe and beyond. The Italian unique unit is the Genoese Crossbowman, an archer unit with a powerful armor-piercing attack. [https://ageofempires.fandom.com/wiki/Italians]
Start Year (W): 6th century AD (Byzantine control and Lombard invasion)
Peak Iconic Year: 15th century AD (height of the Italian Renaissance)

Description: From their island strongholds, the Japanese samurai warriors cultivated a unique and disciplined martial tradition. Build magnificent castles and monasteries, amass vast schools of fishing boats, and field disciplined armies of samurai and powerful siege weapons to dominate the battlefields of Asia. The Japanese unique unit is the Samurai, a powerful infantry unit that excels at fighting other unique units. [https://ageofempires.fandom.com/wiki/Japanese]
Peak Iconic Year: 12th-13th centuries AD (Kamakura Shogunate, rise of the samurai)

Description: Dominate the rugged terrain of northeast China with the skilled hunters, armored cavalry, and gunpowder weaponry of the Great Jin dynasty. The Jurchen unique units are the Iron Pagoda, a cavalryman that occasionally blocks melee attacks, and the Grenadier, a foot soldier who hurls deadly incendiary bombs at his enemies.

From the magnificent temples of Angkor, the Khmer kings ruled over a vast empire that dominated Southeast Asia for centuries. Construct sprawling networks of canals and reservoirs, field powerful armies of war elephants and ballista elephants, and erect awe-inspiring stone monuments to your glory. The Khmer unique unit is the Ballista Elephant, a powerful siege unit mounted atop a mighty war elephant. [https://ageofempires.fandom.com/wiki/Khmer]
Peak Iconic Year: 12th century AD (reign of Suryavarman II, construction of Angkor Wat)

Description: Relive the glory of the Liao dynasty and Kara-Khitai, terrorizing your enemies with mobile hordes and diabolical...source one.

From the rugged peninsula bridging mainland Asia to the islands of Japan, the Korean kingdoms forged a unique and resilient culture. Construct formidable stone fortresses, master the art of siege warfare, and field disciplined armies of archers and powerful war wagons to defend your borders and project your influence across the seas. The Korean unique unit is the War Wagon, a heavily armored wagon that fires multiple arrows. [https://ageofempires.fandom.com/wiki/Koreans]
Peak Iconic Year: 15th century AD (reign of Sejong the Great, advancements in science and technology)

Description: From the forests and marshes of the Baltic, the Lithuanian tribes united to forge a powerful grand duchy that stretched across Eastern Europe. Field swift cavalry and hardy infantry, build formidable wooden castles, and unleash the power of your pagan priests to dominate the battlefields of the north. The Lithuanian unique unit is the Leitis, a fast cavalry unit that gains attack bonuses when fighting alongside other Leitis. [https://ageofempires.fandom.com/wiki/Lithuanians]
Peak Iconic Year: 15th century AD (reign of Vytautas the Great, territorial expansion)

Description: From the vast plains of Pannonia, the Magyar horsemen thundered into Europe and established a powerful kingdom in the heart of the continent. Field swift and deadly cavalry, construct fortified towns and castles, and unleash devastating raids upon your enemies as you carve out your own destiny in the medieval world. The Magyar unique unit is the Huszar, a light cavalry unit that is effective against siege weapons. [https://ageofempires.fandom.com/wiki/Magyars]
Peak Iconic Year: 10th century AD (establishment of Kingdom of Hungary under Stephen I)

Description: From the tropical islands of Southeast Asia, the Malay kingdoms controlled vital trade routes and built powerful maritime empires. Construct bustling ports and markets, amass fleets of swift warships, and field versatile armies of infantry and elephants to dominate the seas and the jungles of the archipelago. The Malay unique unit is the Karambit Warrior, a fast and inexpensive infantry unit that can overwhelm enemies in large numbers. [https://ageofempires.fandom.com/wiki/Malay]
Follow in the footsteps of the great Mansa Musa and become the greatest king of Western Africa.

Deep within the jungles of Central America, the Mayan civilization built magnificent cities and developed advanced knowledge of astronomy and mathematics. Construct towering pyramids and temples, amass vast armies of skilled archers, and field the unique Plumed Archer to dominate the battlefields of the New World. The Mayan unique unit is the Plumed Archer, a fast and powerful archer unit. [https://ageofempires.fandom.com/wiki/Mayans]

From the vast steppes of Central Asia, the Mongol hordes swept across continents, forging the largest contiguous land empire in history. Unleash swift and devastating cavalry archers, utilize powerful siege weaponry, and field the unique Mangudai to conquer all who stand in your path. The Mongol unique unit is the Mangudai, a swift cavalry archer that can fire accurately while moving. [https://ageofempires.fandom.com/wiki/Mongols]
Peak Iconic Year: Early 13th century AD (conquests of Genghis Khan)

Description: From the arid plateaus of Persia, mighty empires rose and fell, leaving behind a legacy of wealth, learning, and military might. Amass vast armies of cavalry, construct magnificent palaces and gardens, and field the unique War Elephant to dominate the battlefields of Asia and the Middle East. The Persian unique unit is the War Elephant, a powerful cavalry unit with high hit points. [https://ageofempires.fandom.com/wiki/Persians]
Peak Iconic Year: 6th century BC (reign of Cyrus the Great)

Description: United by faith and tradition, the Polish kingdoms rose to become a dominant force in Eastern Europe, renowned for their heavy cavalry and unwavering spirit. Field powerful armies of knights and hussars, construct magnificent castles and cathedrals, and unleash your winged hussars upon your enemies to secure victory on the battlefields of the north. The Polish unique unit is the Obuch, an infantry unit that deals extra damage to buildings and has a unique attack animation. [https://ageofempires.fandom.com/wiki/Poles]
Set sail for the new world, discover new routes to unknown lands and expand your trade routes to the mighty African empires.

Rise to the throne of an empire dominating the Mediterranean Sea and defend your borders against countless barbarian invasions. The Roman unique units are the Legionary, a sturdy infantry unit, and the Centurion, a heavy cavalry unit that increases the power of nearby Militia-line units.

From the deserts of Arabia, the Saracens forged a vast empire that stretched from Persia to Spain. Amass vast wealth through trade, construct magnificent mosques and universities, and field versatile armies of camel riders and powerful naval vessels to dominate the battlefields of the Middle East and the Mediterranean. The Saracen unique unit is the Mameluke, a camel rider that throws scimitars.

Experience the diverse cultures and martial spirit of the Mediterranean's crossroads as you build one of the most coveted kingdoms in medieval Europe. The Sicilian unique unit is the Serjeant, a hardy infantry unit that can construct the formidable Donjon.
Peak Iconic Year: 12th century AD (Norman Kingdom of Sicily under Roger II)

Description: From the vast plains of Eastern Europe, the Slavic tribes forged powerful kingdoms and empires that left an enduring mark on the history of the continent. Field hardy infantry and cavalry, construct sturdy fortifications, and unleash the might of your siege weapons to dominate the battlefields of the east. The Slav unique unit is the Boyar, a powerful heavy cavalry unit with high hit points.

From the kingdoms of Iberia, the Spanish conquistadors embarked on voyages of exploration and conquest that reshaped the world. Amass vast wealth from the New World, construct formidable castles and cathedrals, and field powerful armies of conquistadors and missionaries to dominate the battlefields of Europe and the Americas. The Spanish unique unit is the Conquistador, a powerful mounted gunpowder unit.

From the vast steppes of Central Asia, the Tatar hordes emerged as a formidable power, their swift horsemen striking fear into the hearts of their enemies. Field hordes of fast cavalry archers, construct sturdy fortifications, and unleash devastating raids upon your foes to carve out your own empire in the medieval world. The Tatar unique unit is the Keshik, a unique cavalry archer that can convert enemy units.
Peak Iconic Year: 13th-14th centuries AD (height of the Golden Horde)

Description: From the heart of the Holy Roman Empire, the Teutonic Knights forged a powerful state through conquest and colonization. Construct formidable castles and monasteries, field heavily armored infantry and cavalry, and unleash the might of your Teutonic Knights to dominate the battlefields of Northern Europe. The Teuton unique unit is the Teutonic Knight, a powerful infantry unit with very high melee armor.
Start Year (W): 10th century AD (formation of Duchy of Saxony)
Peak Iconic Year: 13th-14th centuries AD (height of Teutonic Order's power)

Description: From the steppes of Central Asia, the Turkish tribes migrated westward and established mighty empires that spanned continents. Field swift horse archers and powerful gunpowder units, construct formidable castles and mosques, and unleash the unique Janissary to dominate the battlefields of the Middle East and Eastern Europe. The Turk unique unit is the Janissary, a powerful hand cannon unit.

From the fertile deltas of Southeast Asia, the Vietnamese kingdoms fiercely defended their independence against powerful neighbors. Construct sturdy wooden fortresses, master the art of guerrilla warfare, and field versatile armies of archers and powerful war elephants to protect your homeland from foreign invaders. The Vietnamese unique unit is the Rattan Archer, an archer unit that is resistant to pierce damage. [https://ageofempires.fandom.com/wiki/Vietnamese]
Peak Iconic Year: 15th century AD (Le Dynasty under Le Loi)

Description: From the fjords of Scandinavia, the Viking longboats carried fierce warriors across the seas to raid and conquer vast territories. Amass wealth through plunder and trade, construct sturdy longboats and warships, and field powerful armies of infantry and berserkers to dominate the battlefields of Northern Europe and beyond. The Viking unique unit is the Berserker, a fast infantry unit that regenerates health. [https://ageofempires.fandom.com/wiki/Vikings]
Peak Iconic Year: 9th-10th centuries AD (height of Viking expansion and raids)

Description: Take the reins of the Kingdom of Shu and fulfil Liu Bei's dream of restoring the Han dynasty. The Shu unique units are the White Feather Guard, an infantryman that slows down units it attacks, and the War Chariot, a vehicle that fires barrages of bolts from a large repeating crossbow.

Step into the shoes of Cao Cao and dominate China with massive cavalry armies and nefarious schemes. The Wei unique units are the Tiger Cavalry, a horseman that levels up as it kills units, and the Xianbei Raider, a cavalry archer that fires storms of arrows into the enemy ranks.

Lead the Sun Clan to glory through infantry and naval prowess. The Wu unique units are the Fire Archer, a ranged soldier that fires incendiary arrows, and the Jian Swordsman, a heavy infantry unit whose shield offers immense protection – until it breaks.
Peak Iconic Year: 229-252 AD (Reign of Sun Quan as Emperor)

Description: Throw off the yoke of foreign domination and rebuild your ancestral kingdom in the mountainous terrain near Lakes Van, Sevan, and Urmia. The Armenian unique units are the Composite Bowman, a skilled archer capable of piercing even the sturdiest armor, and the Warrior Priest, an infantry unit that can fight and heal allied units.
Rise of the powerful Burgundian dukes and early modern European military tactics.
